output.final_deliverable:
Collected links from the Wikipedia Main Page (based only on the provided Main Page content)

1) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page
   Link text/title: Main Page
   Description: "Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia that anyone can edit." The Main Page displays summary information such as the number of active editors and the total number of English articles (evidence from the Main Page content) (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page).

2) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents
   Link text/title: Wikipedia:Contents
   Description: No page description is present in the provided Main Page content for this link, so I cannot provide a 1–2 sentence summary from the evidence available (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contents).

3) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events
   Link text/title: Portal:Current events
   Description: The Main Page shows an "In the news" / current-events section, but the provided Main Page content does not include a standalone description of the Portal:Current events page itself; therefore no 1–2 sentence summary can be given from the provided evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portal:Current_events).

4) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random
   Link text/title: Special:Random (Random article)
   Description: The Main Page lists a "Random article" link in the menu, but the provided content does not include a description of the Special:Random page; no summary can be given from the provided evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Random).

5) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:About
   Link text/title: Wikipedia:About (About Wikipedia)
   Description: The Main Page menu includes an "About Wikipedia" link, but the provided Main Page content does not include a descriptive summary of that page; I cannot provide a 1–2 sentence description from the available evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:About).

6) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us
   Link text/title: Wikipedia:Contact us
   Description: The Main Page includes a "Contact us" link, but the provided Main Page content does not include a description of the Contact page; therefore no summary can be provided from the evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Contact_us).

7) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Contents
   Link text/title: Help:Contents
   Description: "Help:Contents" appears in the Main Page navigation, but the supplied Main Page content does not contain a description of that help page; no summary is available from the provided evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Help:Contents).

8) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Community_portal
   Link text/title: Community portal
   Description: The Main Page shows a link to the Community portal, but the provided content contains no description of that portal page itself, so I cannot produce a 1–2 sentence summary from the evidence given (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Community_portal).

9) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChanges
   Link text/title: Special:RecentChanges (Recent changes)
   Description: The Main Page includes a "Recent changes" link in the menu, but the provided Main Page content does not include a description of the Recent changes page; no summary can be given based on the provided evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChanges).

10) URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:File_upload_wizard
    Link text/title: Wikipedia:File upload wizard
    Description: The Main Page includes an "Upload file" / file-upload-related link, but the provided Main Page content does not include a description of the File upload wizard page; therefore I cannot provide a 1–2 sentence description from the available evidence (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:File_upload_wizard).
output.action_summary: I extracted 10 links that appeared in the provided Main Page content (all URLs are the canonical Wikipedia URLs formed from the link paths present). Only the Main Page entry (item 1) had an explicit descriptive sentence in the provided content. The other nine items were present as links in the supplied Main Page content but lacked standalone descriptions in that content, so I have explicitly indicated where the evidence to produce a 1–2 sentence summary was missing. All citations point to the corresponding Wikipedia URLs shown above.

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

articles in
English
From today's featured article
Shigi Qutuqu
(
c.
1178
– 1260) was a high-ranking official during the early decades of the
Mongol Empire
. The adopted son of the empire's founder
Temüjin
(later titled Genghis Khan) and his wife
Börte
, Shigi Qutuqu played an important role in the codification of
Mongol law
, serving with distinction as an administrator in northern China. He was brought up in Temüjin's household and was one of the first Mongols to become literate. The
Secret History
exaggerates Shigi Qutuqu's role in the years after the empire's foundation, but he was nevertheless appointed to several high-ranking legal positions, in which he served during the
Mongol conquest of the Jin dynasty
. He was the commander during the only Mongol defeat in the
western campaign against Khwarazmia
, being overcome by
Jalal al-Din
at the 1221
Battle of Parwan
. Shigi Qutuqu continued his career as an official during the reign of his adopted brother
Ögedei Khan
, Genghis's successor.
(
Full article...
)

About
Did you know ...
Mike Brunson
... that former NFL player
Mike Brunson
(pictured)
was known for making banana ice cream?
... that "
There's a Hole in the City
" is a Nebula Award–nominated short story that describes the September 11 attacks alongside the "summoned ghosts from past disasters" in New York City?
... that French businessman
André Kieffer
was described as a "one-man party" and "easily the most aggressive and controversial figure" in the territorial assembly of Chad?
... that only black
Girardinus metallicus
males put on a courtship show, while yellow and colorless males rely on coercion?
... that
Hermann E. Sieger
, a Nazi Party official, was considered to be a trusted contact of the Liechtenstein government?
... that
the murder of a gay man in Afghanistan
forced his brother to flee to Turkey and his boyfriend to go into hiding due to harassment from the Taliban?
... that the
Group Architects
led strikes against traditional teaching styles at the Auckland School of Architecture in 1948, which were attended by 142 of 160 students?
... that
GameChat
was inspired by Nintendo developers' frustrations over video-conferencing software during the
COVID-19
pandemic?
... that
Sukumar Barua
chose to work as a chef instead of pursuing poetry as a career because his pay was too good?

Bavarian

Kurt Eisner
, who had organized the
German Revolution

Wittelsbach monarchy
and established Bavaria as a republic, was assassinated.

–
Nanjing decade
: In the first battle of the
Warlord Rebellion in northeastern Shandong
against the
Nationalist government
of China, a 24,000-strong rebel force led by
Zhang Zongchang
was defeated at
Zhifu
by 7,000
NRA
troops.
1973
– After accidentally straying into the airspace of the
Israeli-occupied Sinai Peninsula
,
Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114
was shot down by two Israeli
fighter aircraft
, killing 108 of the 113 people on board.

Today's featured picture
The
masked trogon
(
Trogon personatus
) is a species of bird in the family Trogonidae, the
trogons
. Fairly common in humid highland forests in South America, mainly in the
Andes
and on
tepuis
, it is resident in Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Guyana, Peru and Venezuela. It is a mid-sized trogon, averaging 27 centimetres (11 in) in length and 56 grams (2.0 oz) in mass. Like all members of its family, it displays
sexual dimorphism
. The male has upperparts, head and upper chest of variously green or reddish-bronze colouring, with a red belly and lower breast, while the female is brown above, with a pinkish to red b
